titleStmt.title: [Engraving of the likeness of] Lewis Cass, [Secretary of War from 1831-1836] / engraved by P.[?] B. Welch : a machine-readable transcription

availability.p: This work is the property of The Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: [Engraving of the likeness of] Lewis Cass, [Secretary of War from 1831-1836] / engraved by P.[?] B. Welch
bibl.note: An engraving of the likeness of Lewis Cass, Secretary of War from 1831-1836, by P.(?) B. Welch. Cass was appointed Secretary of War by President Andrew Jackson and served in that position just prior to the removal of the Cherokees.
The Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with Microsoft Word spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points

figure.head:
Engraved by P.B. Welch from a Drawing by J.B.
LEWIS CASS.
Lewis Cass
figure.figDesc: An engraving of the likeness of Lewis Cass
